title: Prohibitin 2 ameliorates cisplatin-induced acute kidney injury by modulating mitochondrial homeostasis.
abstract: Acute kidney injury (AKI), associated with a major health burden globally, is frequently caused by nephrotoxic agents, specifically cisplatin. Prohibitin (PHB) 2, a highly conserved mitochondrial protein localized at the inner mitochondrial membrane, is key to maintaining mitochondrial respiration, cristae morphogenesis, and regulating cell death. Despite being extensively assessed in chronic kidney disease models, the role of PHB2 in AKI, particularly cisplatin-induced AKI, warrants further exploration.
